The three of us Ray Marco myself, who made the final decision after merging the opinions of the air.
A chance.
So as I said, it's a.
It was a hierarchical process and we recruited area chairs to cover the main topics.
And the program committee was then nominated by Area Chair, so they essentially recruited their own referees.
This was the process we adopted this year.
And to reduce the effort of the reviewers, we also made some changes in the way in which we allocated the reviews to be done.
So initially we only actually asked for two reviews rather than the normal 3.
And only went for a third review in the event that there was an inconsistency in the first 2.

In this case, the third review was sort or in the case that we had two very positive reviews, then the paper was pushed for consideration for the special issue Journal issues of machine learning and data mining and knowledge discovery.
So these were the sort of special issues arising that are published at the conference of their available here.

We had two very positive reviews.
Then they were put forward for that and then a further review was sort to sort of also assess the suitability of the paper for a Journal publication.

Selected.
So I already mentioned twice, so this is third time the area chairs were at our intention was they would control the process they would recruit their referees.
They would bid for papers, they would allocate the referees and they would lead the resolution of conflicts and discussions.
So they became a sort of kingpins.
It were holding the process together and then would rank their batch of papers and the aim of this was to personalize the reviewing process to sort of.
Have somebody with a.

An overview of the whole process for each paper and hopefully guard against the kind of arbitrariness that can happen when you know you aren't actually keeping trams on who is saying what about what paper.
So that was our intention.

As for.

It were holding the process together and then would rank their batch of papers and the aim of this was to personalize the reviewing process to sort of.
